subject: The NFL Returns
event:
Life is magical and full of joy!!!

Haloo, halay, the Jets and Giants won today.

Solid, convincing victories for both teams.  Not quite total domination, no, but the scores would have been even more lopsided if not for a couple bad turnovers.

The Jets were the morning game.  Mark Sanchez made his debut with Joe Willie Namath on hand to root him on.  Can't ask for a better omen than that.  Based on what I saw today, we have a quarterback, we have a coach, and boy, do we have a defense.  Harris and Scott and Jenkins were monsters (though Vernon Gholston, finally given a chance to start, was still invisible).  Of course, it was the Texans, so one can't read too much into this.  Still, a road victory, and there were commentators who claimed this was going to be the year when the Texans turned the corner.  I loved the play when Kris Jenkins just swatted a Texan lineman aside one-handed to charge past him to the QB.  Next week will be the real test, when the Jets and their new defense and their kid QB face the Patriots.

Afternoon, and it was the G-Men.  The game was not nearly as close as the final score.  One of the Washington touchdowns came on a fake field goal at the end of the half, the other in garbage time as the clock was winding down on the Giants victory.  Albert Haynesworth, the big free agent acquisition Danny Snyder made this year, did help throttle the Giants running game, kinda sorta, though if you add Bradshaw and Jacobs together, they still had more than a hundred yards.  Eli made up for it, and won the game through the air.  (We won't mention that ghastly interception).  The Giant defense harassed Jason Campbell all day, and completely shut down Santana Moss, the Redskin deep threat.  Favorite play was Osi stripping Campbell of the ball, picking it up, and running it in for a TD.  The only downer on the day was the injuries.  Danny Ware was lost right at the start of the game, and Hakeem Nicks sprained an ankle in the second half.  Next week will be the real test for the Giants as well, when they have to face the hated Cowboys in Jerry Jones' Temple of Excess with its infamous punt-blocking scoreboard.  

That's next week, though.  Tonight, at least, it's all smiles in the Big Apple, and down here in Santa Fe as well.

(Comments welcome, but stay on topic.  For this post, "on topic" means football)

comments.article:
While I am sad that your Giants beat my woeful Redskins (and they were quite horrible, pretty much all day), I will be cheering for your team next week, because anybody beating the Cowboys is okay in my book.

Still, the Hunter Smith TD was pretty fun.

I don't know that I would call the Redskins woeful. That Giants defense is going to be top notch in the league this year. There is something to be said about a team that hangs around. Watching the game, it seemed a lot more lopsided than it was, the fact that it wasn't shows strong character. Even at the end of the game, I'll disagree with Mr. Martin, its not garbage time until there's no chance the game will be lost. If the Redskins make the onside kick(I know its low %) they tie the game. The important thing is, I love how physical that game was, great stuff.

Week one just about gone, but yeah already looking to next week. Patriots and Jets, Cowboys and Giants. That's going to be a fabolous day for football.

Glad to see Cutler coming out awful in the Sunday night game, couldn't happen to a better person. Thats what you get for complaining your way out of Denver.
comments.subject: Not so fast

comments.article:
I have to say I was pleasantly surprised by the Jets. But I am taking a wait and see attitude with them. I have had my heart broken more than once.

The Giants are a force to be reckoned with.

I was also happy to see the Falcons playing well too.

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: horns
comments.article: I didn't get to see too much of the Jets match, but the Giants were entertaining. And my fantasy gridiron team is doing pleasingly terribly. Life truly is magical and full of joy here in NYC. :)

Giants Defense looked good. Hopefully it doesn't look that good against the Cowboys next week.Fortunately the Cowboys have a real offense and Coach unlike the Redskins.  I love football season. My grades improve, because I write my papers while watching. Football frees the mind and body. Except when I get stuck watching an awful Texans game :(
comments.subject: Football

comments.article: Watching the Packer game right now! I ♥ this time of year :D

The Giants won't miss a beat with Spagnolo gone, also it looks like Osi is in top shape after today's game.  Sanchez looks amazing, I am a Patriots fan but you can't take anything away from that kid.  Probably the best deal the Jets have made!

As a Redskins fan, I didn't even want to watch the game.

You don't know the level of hatred that we hold for Snyder. One of my friends got the rare opportunity to heckle him the other day, and the jealousy factor was high.

Things really haven't been the same since Cooke died. It's no fun being a Skins fan anymore. Snyder's taken all the joy out of it, and priced us out of loving our team.

The guy is such an asshole. I live right up the street from Redskins Park (I drive past it all the time), and it's been there for YEARS now, but Snyder wouldn't let our county call itself "The Home of the Redskins" until we paid him $250,000. Which we did last year, so we could finally put it on our tourist info stuff.

So what does he do? We hear in the preseason he's thinking of moving training camp closer to DC.

Haaaaaaaaaaate hate hate hate hate hate Snyder.

Let's not get started on our QB situation because we're all completely done with that, too.

Arrrrrrrrrrrgggggggghhhh.

It's the start of another depressing year for us. Especially those of us who are lifelong fans.

Please destroy the Cowboys for us ♥

in me finally deciding to give up the burgundy and gold and join my beloved in cheering on the teams of our homeland.

But I'm not giving up my Sonny Jurgensen #9 jersey, and I'll always love Riggo.

The costs of going to an NFL game, let alone being a season ticket holder has priced normal people out of up-close feverent fandom. Couldn't believe the story about the 'Skins suing people who have lost their jobs and can't pay the exorbitant fees for their season tickets.
comments.subject: Snyder was a huge factor
Re: Snyder was a huge factor
Re: Snyder was a huge factor

comments.article: And of course the actual season opener: Steelers and Titans slug it out to a brutal OT finish. Now that's some football.

it hurt...a little. But I will take a loss like that any day of the week. Just not too many of them. Excellent football game and it makes me feel a lot more comfortable for the rest of the season. I think our D can stand toe to toe with any O in the league and our O line are as good as always. Now if we could actually just get an O to go behind that line and score. Well...to be fair we did upgrade our offensive threat a little, but it is still our weakness.

Special teams sucked in that game as well for us, but I am hoping that will iron itself out next weekend against the Texans. If both teams play the way they did this week... it's already over. This is foiotball though so who knows?
comments.subject: As a Titans fan...

comments.article:
I gotta admit, Sanchez surprised me. I did not expect to see that poise and confidence. Nothing about the guy seemed legit when he came out of college--he was leaving school despite his coach's advice; he wasn't one of the "big name" college QBs; he was the least-experienced of the bunch--but man, he actually looked like a pro today.

As a Bills fan, this, of course, makes me sad. But since you write my favorite books, Mr. Martin, I won't cry. Not here. Not now...I...I...waaaauuuuggggghhhhhhhhhh!!
comments.subject: Wowza

comments.article:
"The Jets were the morning game." That brought back memories of my days stationed in Cali. On football Sundays I often didn't roll out of bed except to wee and pay the Dominoes guy.

Speaking of wee... Weeeee!

Yah, you got it right. Wins against the Texans and Jason Campbell who aren't world beaters beats the alternative. Sanchez looked very good. Fingers crossed. Why would you run a short yardage play right at Haynesworth? Something about short yardage offensive plays just boggles the Giants 'minds'. Anyways, think healthy thoughts.

As far as the "Temple of Excess" goes, the new Meadowlands Stadium is shaping up to be quite spectacular as well. John Mara has said that he liked some of the elements of Yankee Stadium. Now that is an Imperial Palace.
Jets and Texans was a fun game (even though my brother had problems with the refs).
comments.subject: Lot's of magic

comments.article: I am a die hard Steelers fan, but i will be cheering J-E-T-S Jets! Jets! Jets! next week when they play the Patriots. lol
comments.subject: Football!

comments.upictitle: a riot of confused people: Rorschach by tribble_graphix
comments.article: I'm so happy about my Jets.  I feel like we finally might have a quarterback who can give us a future.

Redskins did much better than I expected. But even Eli couldn't make the Giants lose.

Eagles completely dismantled the Panthers, so that could be trouble later for the Giants.
Yeah, but McNabb is hurt again.  Big, big blow for Philly.  Looks like Mike Vick may be playing more than expected.

Awesome.

I'll have to wait til next week to see my Rams actually score.

... What, they might.
Living in Southern California, I got to see all of Mark Sanchez's games.  The kid is the real deal.  As a 49er's fan, I can't help but be a bit jealous.  Although, Singletary is making us look good.

How them Broncos? I know, I know - they're probably still a 5-11 team but the defense played well and they gave Broncos Nation a highlight to cherish for eternity. According to the NFL Network, it was the longest play from scrimmage during the last minute of any NFL game, in history.

I dont know what to say about this team and their wild, unbelieveable wins. First there was the 'tip drill' in Minnesota in '96, last years gaffe with Ed Hochuli, and now this year's incredible ending. I dont care if we go 1-15 (maybe) but that win was worth every ounce of emotional investment into a team!

(PS, the Giants -and their defense- looks great. Still not sold on the Jets. Too tough of a division to make an impact, in my opinion)

comments.upictitle: Canary In A Coal Mine: NYG - Strahan "GIANTS WIN"
comments.article: It was wonderful to see Osi be BACK so emphatically! Highlight of the night to be sure!
your not-a-blog provides invaluable coverage for me!
comments.subject: now that i'm in another fantasy league

comments.article:
I hope my Chiefs get another crack at the Ravens in the playoffs. I've never seen a football player do a celebration dance on a four yard run until today, and their ENTIRE TEAM acts like that. With our starters healthy, we'd have won this game.

With Flowers there to cover Mason instead of Maurice Legget, we'd have had two more turnovers, and its inestimable how negatively affected we were by Matt Cassel being out.

Shocker the Redskins lost.

I wonder if sports radio in other cities isn't as sad as the one in DC? Maybe not sad, but absurdly optimistic...

I'm not one of those Washington people who cheer for Dallas out of spite. I support my team, even though them losing is more and more the expected outcome.

For some reason, its like something in the franchise doesn't really want to win.
comments.subject: Maybe Detroit...

comments.article: I thought the Jets looked pretty dominant.  I know everyone seems to think they will take a step back this year, but Sanchez looks like he's going to skip over the rookie jitters.   I'm a Patriots fan (sorry) and I'm really looking forward to the game next week.  I don't care what anyone says about the Bills or Dolphins, the Jets are always the biggest threat to the Pats within the division.

I was out of the house for the Jets game, but I watched my NFC team, the Giants, impressively handle the Redskins from start to finish. I agree with another comment regarding the "garbage time" score. The defense, which had looked impressive all day, suddenly forgot how to play. But a win is a win, as they say.

Two final thoughts. How nice was it to see Osi play at a high level today? And after the Jets spanked the Texans today, I too am looking forward to the Pats-Jets game next week.

I’m a die hard football fan and my team also won yesterday 4-nil... Ho wait, you mean the football where they don’t actually use their feet with the ball!! Don’t really know about that one :¬)

Don’t you guys think they should have called it american rugby?! (cause that’s what it is...)

Just teasing :¬)
comments.subject: Die hard football fan

comments.article: I'm very happy for Saturday's game and that Mark Sanchez finally had the opportunity to prove himself to those who hadn't followed him previously. :)
comments.subject: As a USC Fan
